page.title: 11KEIGHLEY FEAST WEEK
page.content: For the last 150-200 years Keighley has had two weeks holiday around June/July. Feast Week was originally for maintaining machinery in the mills and factories. The Keighley people took their holidays in their Feast weeks. Today some of the larger firms still close down for two weeks. Schools are closed for the last week inJune. A survey of local travel agents showed that the majority of Keighley people still take their holidays in the Feast weeks. The second most popular time is the September break, another traditional holiday in the area. Recently efforts have been made to change school holidays to the normal pattern, with no break in June. However local feeling has been against this. Tradition lives on!
